description.narrative: The Dutch government is committed to the development and implementation of agreements between companies, social organizations, trade unions and government in the field of International Corporate Social Responsibility (IMVO) and it granted a subsidy of EUR 996.346to ensure a structured and professional involvement of civil society and trade unions in the preparation of IMVO covenants in the Netherlands. The subsidy is Intended for Dutch based established civil society organizations involved in the IMVO Covenant negotiations. The current covenant trajectories are on: Nutrition, insurers, gold, floriculture, sustainable natural stone. The administration of the funds is operated by Oxfam Novib on request of the MVO Platform and the Ministry.

participating-org.narrative:
The contractual counteroart is HIVOS, which will channel the funds to MFTransparency.
MicroFinance Transparency (MFTransparency) is a non-profit organization that promotes transparent pricing in the global microfinance industry. It started in 2008, as concerns were rising about the lack of transparency of costs clients paid to microfinance institutions (MFIs) and high interest rates some MFIs were charging their clients. Its goal is to be the venue for the microfinance industry to publicly demonstrate its commitment to pricing transparency, integrity and poverty alleviation. Its vision is an industry operating with healthy free market conditions where consumers and other stakeholders can make informed decisions.
MfTransparency publishes the real costs for clients through the organization’s website (www.mftransparency.org), including ways of calculation of real cost and establishing benchmarks for countries. From its start until now, MFTransparency has become the leader and conscience of the microfinance industry in transparency on pricing. Numerous investors use the website in their analysis of MFIs.
The former MicroNed members (ICCO, HIVOS and Oxfam Novib) have been very instrumental in the past by giving a start-subsidy to the organization. This has allowed MFTransparency to prove its quality and as a concequence, MFTransparency has obtained an important place in the Social Performance Task Force, a worldwide network of more than 1,300 institutions, practicioners, investors, donors, networks, etc.). Oxfam Novib has given earlier support to MFTransparency from the LAC-budget in 2008 and 2009.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

description.narrative: Strengthened CSOs: # CSOs increasingly participate in or initiate influencing and advocacy efforts on promotion of a transparent, accountable and inclusive financial sector and/or on promotion of financial inclusion of people living in poverty.
